title: batch_normalization layer argument name and documentation wrong in core and contrib layers
body_html: The batch normalization layers both in core and contrib take a center argument that controls whether a variable beta should be created that is then added after the normalization. The name of the argument (center) and even more so the documentation (center: If True, subtract beta. If False, beta is ignored.) indicate however that this argument controls whether the mean of the input is subtracted as part of the normalization.

body: The batch normalization layers both in core and contrib take a `center` argument that controls whether a variable beta should be created that is then **added after the normalization**. The name of the argument (`center`) and even more so the documentation (_center: If True, subtract `beta`. If False, `beta` is ignored._) indicate however that this argument controls whether the mean of the input is subtracted as part of the normalization.
